name: Alvear Palace Hotel

reviews.text: This is a lovely property in a very interesting part of Buenos Aires. The style of the hotel is elegant and the service is quiet and efficient down to the private butler on your floor. The rooms are spacious and the food was very good with a lovely breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Lovely Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: “I loved the fact the hotel was small. I felt I received more personal attention.The staff was wonderful!! They went beyond their duty to make our stay excellent.

reviews.text: Our suite was just beautifully appointed, the staff very helpful, polite, and professional, excellent breakfast buffet included in room rate.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Huge Rooms, Great Location

reviews.text: I and a group of buddies stayed here after spending a week in Cordoba staying in a hunting lodge, so perhaps I was just so happy to be in such a plush place after the lodge, but even discounting that, this place was incredible. Very historic and beautiful. The staff is incredibly polished and knowledgable. They were very discrete and professional. The lobby bar was terrific, and a perfect place to wind down at the end of a day of sightseeing and walking. Our rooms were all large, with huge bathrooms and fine fixtures. Really enjoyed how quiet it was too, plus each floor has its own separate floor concierge who looks after every little detail. We needed a special electrical adaptor (an oddball machine), and they managed to find one for us in a couple of hours. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, but it was superb, and the buffet was enormous, with incredible breads, pasteries, fruit, etc. This is our "go to" hotel when we go to Buenos Aires now, a terrific place and we cannot recommend it more highly.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Alvear Palace in October 2012 for 5 days and had a great time. Accomodations are just beautiful, the breakfast buffet was outstanding with lots of variety and the staff was kind and gracious.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is class personified. The interiors are elegant and tasteful. The staff is professional, friendly, and helpful. The breakfast buffet is an experience worthy of a special journey. There is a very good gym and a wonderful old wood-paneled bar that feels like it's been around for a hundred years. The concierge booked all of our restaurants before we arrived and we were exceedingly happy with the choices. We, also, were upgraded to a beautiful suite when we arrived. When, after a few days
reviews.title: Maybe the best I've ever experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we decided, on the spur of the moment, to take a "side trip" to Bariloche, the concierge took care of everything: airline reservations, transfers, luggage storage and reservations in Patagonia. It was, all in all, a heavenly experience.
reviews.title: Excellent city hotel with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Alvear Palace for 2 nights through Leading Hotels of the World. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite that was magnificent. The butler made sure that we had everything we needed during our stay. The concierge helped us with dinner reservations and printed our boarding passes. The buffet breakfast was included in our room rate and was excellent. We are looking forward to our one night stay at the end of our trip. Staying at the Alvear is truly a memorable experience.
reviews.title: Lap of luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the two nights during New Year's eve. Wonderful service and spa amenities. Had our own butler but frankly I didn't know what to do with him; gave him two dresses to press and shoes to shine. If I had my dogs with me, I would've asked them to be walked! My only grievance is really not about the hotel itself but that fact that we were surrounding by so many annoying tourists (with obnoxious service me first attitudes) during this busy season. The brunch buffet restaurant is ridiculously overpriced and so was La Bourgogne. We had dined at La Bourgogne's sister restaurant in Mendoza where we felt it was more value for your money. Plus, there is not an outdoor restaurant/ cafe here (I went to the Parc Hyatt instead for my afternoon coffees/ happy hour drinks). Would I return? Yes if I got a deal on the price (we were paying US$500+ a night due to the New Year's holiday). Would I eat at the hotel? No. Found many other places outside of the hotel more to my liking. Just remember if you choose to stay here: you are in the Recoletta and this is one of the more higher-end, expensive hotels in a posh neighborhood... so that's what you're going to get.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over New Year -yes it is expensive but you certainly get what you pay for including your own butler who was very helpful. Hotel in an excellent position for sightseeing, but taxis always available to go further afield, from the very attentive doormen. Overall a superb hotel.
reviews.title: SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives: Lounge Bar service very slow, Snooty concierges.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives, Location in the rich part of town, easy walks to parks and Avita's grave, good size rooms, wonderful breakfast buffet..value for money ?? Maybe too expensive but your buying the name
reviews.title: The Historic Elegance... that was once Buenos Aires

reviews.text: Walking into Alvear Palace Hotel is like stepping back into time... when Buenos Aires was in its heyday of the rich and famous. It is truly the most elegant hotel in Buenos Aires. We were here for 8 days so we booked a junior suite on American Express platinum and was upgraded to a full suite with a butler. The room even had an alcove which was like a small office which was great. We had free wireless and breakfast. The service is just excellent!
reviews.title: really a palace

reviews.text: The hotel is located in the lovely Recoleta area. It is only around 3 blocks from the famous cemetery where Eva "Evita" Peron is tombed. It is also walking distance to the fine arts museum and many parks. Taxis are fairly cheap to get around, but try using radio cabs and be careful with 100 Argentine peso bills. Have lots of smaller bills.... the $100 peso is being counterfeited and especially used by taxi drivers. We got our money at the hotel and legal exchanges. We had not problems at all... we were warned so I feel I should share!
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea at the Alvear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only other advice would be to eat italian food... the best next to Italy and go to a real tango club called a Milonga. You will see just how good all Argentine's do the tango. Fabulous!
reviews.title: A touch of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was so fabulous - I would run back to Buenos Aires in a second just to stay there again! It is not a very large hotel, but it is beautiful and I found the staff to be excellent. We were there with a group of well seasoned travelers and every one of them expressed how wonderful the hotel was. I loved the location, close to Cementerio de la Recoleta, and walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. I would recommend this hotel without any reservations at all!
reviews.title: SO Fabulous!

reviews.text: Superb service, superb rooms, wonderful service from the on-floor butlers (though a couple of peculiar calls about ashtrays found on the housekeeping trolleys near to my room). Breakfast is delightful, though do dress appropriately.
reviews.title: Very, very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Alvear Palace has lovely classic rooms that are spacious and comfortable. The bathrooms, fortunately, are large and modern. They are great about giving upgrades to past guests, even if a previous stay was only a week ago. The location is excellent, but it is not really worth eating at the hotel. The food is uninspired, despite what any reviews might tell you.
reviews.title: Lovely classic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service, the ambience, the small gracious touches -- everything about our stay was perfect. We loved the sense of traditional elegance and the modern amenities. The bar is truly an escape into another era. Most of all every member of the staff was outstanding in attitude and competence.
reviews.title: A truly wonderful experience

reviews.text: The Alvear is THE great hotel of BA. Like Raffles, the Old Cataract, George V, Danielli or the Waldorf Astoria, perfect service is just part of the reason you are here. You are following in the footsteps of history, and whatever I say will not change that. The butler was perfect - we could not have been more welcome, the Lobby bar is classic (visit, even if you are not staying here) and the room is spacious and luxurious in a Louis XV kind of way. But it just isn't perfect. With its history and at this price, it should be. Like the Old Cataract, Savoy and Waldorf, the money men need to lift this into the 21st century. It needs a real pool (maybe at the sacrifice of those acres of ballroom), the lobby bar needs the band back on the balcony, and it suffers from lack of outdoor space. But then again, I am sure none of these bothered Greta Garbo.
reviews.title: A grand old dame

reviews.text: I had the privilege of staying here on business this month and experience the first class service I have heard so much about. The butler service was fantastic and exactly what you would want after a few long haul flights. And the bed was oh so comfortable. Black out curtains were also a plus. The all day dining restaurant L´Orangerie was beautiful with a lovely atrium. Breakfast was good but not excellent. Buffet lunch here was wonderful. The lobby bar has a real elegant old world feel to it and service was great. Drinks are expensive which is to be expected. If you are looking for a real luxury hotel experience in BA, then this is your hotel. Also, if you are looking to tick off another place in "1,000 places to see before you die", tick!!
reviews.title: First class luxury hotel

reviews.text: As I stayd there since 1993, the Alvear represents the Uniqueness of luxury. The service is amazing from the doormen (always the same two guys since I have been going) to the room cleaners. All are fabulous, they are always helpful. The hotel is located in the best area of Buenos Aires. The only little hitch is the Fitness and spa, they only have a tiny pool that was actually made in a suite and transformed ... Apparently they will be creating a nice SPA shortly.
reviews.title: Amongst the very best 5 stars in the world
Exceptional service
reviews.text: Nevertheless, just an absolute delight. And at night dont look further, La Bourgogne is the best place in Town (see my report on La Bourgogne), The breakfast is a Feast ! difficult to compare with any other breakfast . And the Hermes eau d'orange perfumes the rooms and the entire atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't stay in the hotel I must say, I stayed around the corner in the more modest melia boutique which was fantastic and at a more affordable rate but I came here almost every night to finish off the party in the cigar room...service is excellent they allowed us to smoke our own cigars after purchasing a few first of course and the drinks where amazing and all cigar come with chocolate truffles. You might find the random douche but the ambiance and the service def makes up for it....I've never drank so much and enjoyed myself as I did in alvear. They really keep it going.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been very fortunate in enjoying great travel on all continents. No hotel in the world, for us, compares to the Alvear and we have enjoyed staying there on several occasions over a period of twenty-five years. It is perfect in every way - the rooms, services, dining. It is expensive but worth every single cent. Located in the beautiful Recoleta neighborhood, the location is perfect whatever your interests. The expansive morning buffet breakfast in the beautiful atrium is a hearty and delicious way to start the day. The floor butler and all staff are gracious and incredibly helpful. Small and important touches abound - the butler offering to have two garments pressed (free) when we arrived, the fruit, flowers and so much more. The rooms are spacious, very comfortable and elegantly appointed. We would not consider staying at any other hotel in Buenos Aires and have not found an equal to the Alvear anywhere.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Elegant Small Beautiful Hotel - Best hotel in Buenos Aires. I stayed at the Alvear Palace once, but can say it ranks with the best hotels in the World. The staff at the reception desk go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. They are never intimidating. The Alvear is expensive, but worth it. The breakfast buffet is included. I also ate in La Bourgogne on the lower level of the Alvear Palace, recommended. There are several high end shops in the vicinity of the Alvear. Famous cemetery and Art Museum are only a short walk away from the Alvear. The excellent service and common sense nature of the staff will pull me back, if I should return to Argentina. Recommended.
reviews.title: Elegant Small Beautiful Hotel - Best

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Alvear Palace on eight occasions over four years and each stay was better than the last. The elegant atmosphere is only surpassed by the service, which is impeccable --from the bellman to the front desk to the concierge to the floor butler. No request has ever been denied and all of my expectations have been met or exceeded. I have stayed both solo and with my wife, and she was made to feel at home as well in a beautiful suite. Being greeted by name in an international hotel adds a certain level of comfort and the staff has always made me feel welcome. Whether it is scarce ballet tickets, a personal tour, or a hard to find gift, the concierge will find it. They tell me that they "like a challenge." And, by the way, I like the way the Alvear smells.
reviews.title: A true classic!

reviews.text: This pearl in the heart of the Ricoleta region of Buenos Aries is a delightful oasis of calm & tranquillity. Reflecting the French “Empire” style, I am reminded a little of the beautiful Crillon Hotel in Paris. Clearly the Alvear Palace is not as grand…but nor are its prices.
reviews.title: The Crillon In Buenos Aries…well almost.

reviews.text: Kind & courteous staff attend discretely to guest’s needs and a knowledgeable Concierge is on hand for last minute trips & restaurant ideas.
reviews.title: Elegance without pretension

reviews.text: The lobby bar is a friendly and well-staffed place to pass away a happy morning, reading the papers & drinking excellent coffee or to close the day with a light meal & fine glass of the House Red...Malbec of course.
reviews.title: Favorite Hotel Experience

description: The Alvear Palace Hotel is situated in the most elegant neighbourhood of Buenos Aires, La Recoleta. It is an area of extensive parks, wide avenues, and luxurious architecture in a classical style, where the best restaurants, cafes, antique shops and boutiques of Buenos Aires, are to be found. Some of the main museums and cultural centres are close by, and the financial area is only five minutes away.A symbol of elegance is bornOriginally built as a luxury hotel to accommodate the increasing amount of European visitors arriving in Buenos Aires at the time, the Alvear Palace was transformed in 1932 into a model of the highest expression of refinement. The majestic rooms and suites, as well as the lobby and public areas, are reminiscent of the Louis XV and Louis XVI styles, which are evident in the furniture, the crystal chandeliers, walls decorated with gold leaf and works of art of famous artists.The eleven-floor luxurious building with five basement levels stands as an undisputed symbol of the city, on the corner of Alvear Avenue and Ayacucho Street.The second foundationContinuous work and dedication, guided by the maximum standards of international excellence, led to the designation of the Alvear Palace Hotel as a member of the Leading Hotels of the World in 1993, an organization that recognizes the best hotels in the world.
